actions.text: Referred to House Committee on International Relations.

official_title: A bill to amend the Foreign Military Sales Act to allow Congress to disapprove any sale to a country of defense articles or services which causes the total annual sales to such country to exceed $50 million.

summary.text: Permits the Congress to disapprove, under the Foreign Military Sales Act, any sale to a country of defense articles or services which causes the total annual sales to such country to exceed $50,000,000 in a given fiscal year.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Foreign Military Sales Act to allow Congress to disapprove any sale to a country of defense articles or services which causes the total annual sales to such country to exceed $50 million.
